channel.title: Avast! problem
channel.description: Whenever I turn on On-Access Protection on Avast! it keeps saying that common used programs are viruses. Even chrome and java! Now, can anyone please help me and tell me what to do? Or at least tell me a better antivirus?

item.title: Avast! problem
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Which virus does it say it is?

Read full topic

item.title: Avast! problem
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:5, topic:289975”]Take backup and reinstall Windows and install Opera, IE is shit and have a bigger chance give you viruses.

T4_: Not all AV are resource hogs, and it is a great protection when you need it.[/quote]
I’ve used Windows XP x64 for my rig and have never had any difficulty with malware.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Avast! problem
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

AVs are just resource hogs. If you dumb enough to ‘catch’ a virus, you deserve it.

Read full topic

item.title: Avast! problem
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

antivirus is a pretty lacking term. honestly you would be better off without one

or, while i dont particularly like to say this…

switch to linux.

Read full topic

item.title: Avast! problem
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It is possible that a virus infected your commonly used programs. As for a better antivirus, I’d instead recommend an Operating System that isn’t prone to viruses, linux. (I’d recommend Kubuntu or Xubuntu for you in particular)

Read full topic
